Class Dijkstra

  • java.lang.Object
    • Dijkstra

  • class Dijkstra
extends java.lang.Object

    The Dijkstra algorithm calculates the shortest path between two vertices, if such a path exists.

    Author:
    C. Bruckmann, R. Wagner

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Dijkstravertex curVertex
      A Dijkstravertex which contains the current vertex.

      Current vertex.

      Boolean for the state of completition of the algorithm.

      static java.util.Comparator<Dijkstravertex> indexComparator

      Integer that defines the startingpoint of this algorithm.
      static boolean startAndEndInG
      Boolean that checks whether the start and endvertex are one and the same vertex.
      static java.util.List<Edge> startEdges
      List of edges from the startingpoint of the algorithm.
      Vertex startVertex
      The startvertex of the Dijkstra.
      int steps
      Counter for the amount of steps taken.
      private java.util.Queue<Dijkstravertex> unvisited
      Queue with unvisited Dijkstravertices.

      A hashtable of integers and unvisited Dijkstravertices
      static java.util.List<Dijkstravertex> visited
      List for already visited Dijkstravertices.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Dijkstra

        public Dijkstra(int s,
                int e,
                Graph g)

        Constructor for the Dijkstra object.

        Parameters:
        s - Index of the startvertex
        e - Index of the endvertex
        g - Graph on which the Dijkstra shall be executed

    • Method Detail

      • checkParameters

        public boolean checkParameters()
        An error message is displayed if the function returns false.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the graph and the vertexset are not null and start and end are contained in the graph.

      • getQueue

        public java.util.Queue<Dijkstravertex> getQueue()

      • performAStep

        public boolean performAStep()

        Actual calculation of one step of the Dijkstra.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the graph exists and contains start and end. So it returns checkParameters()

        public void recolor()
